content.raw:
This form of API was suggested in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/229](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/229/added-basic-support-for-alpha-textures-in/diff#chg-CMakeLists.txt), I kinda agree with it because most of the times you would want to set all three parameters to get some decent transparency behavior. Specifically, in the experiments I made two sided rendering should always be enabled and the alpha parameter is a sensible default that helps with shadow casting.

Basically if you only enable alpha you will have wrong shadows and non-visible faces behind the transparent objects, which I believe is not what any user would want. I’m, afraid that if we split into three setters the user might be tricked into only calling “EnableAlphaRendering” and left to wonder why there is so many glitches?

I’m open to having both the three setters and the user facing convenience function above, if you want symmetry between getters and setters.
